question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Ensure that the code you generate is executable for display. Please regenerate the front-end for the report and chart configuration page. Requirements: 1) Include custom metrics, custom reports, and custom charts. Please refer to other successful cases. I want to implement a complex statistical report. After configuration is complete, it should be possible to see the configuration style of the report.

checklist.title: Is the custom metrics configuration functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code provides a complete custom metrics definition interface, including metric name, data source, calculation formula, filtering conditions, and aggregation methods. Check if the interface supports complex metric composition (derived metrics based on other metrics). Score 0 if the core metric definition logic is missing, 5 if only basic metric definition is available, and 10 if advanced features like conditional metrics and calculated fields are fully implemented.

checklist.title: Is the custom reports configuration system comprehensively designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the report configuration includes essential elements such as title, description, time range selector, refresh intervals, sharing permissions, and export options. Check if the code implements template selection, layout customization, and conditional formatting rules. Deduct 5 points if saved report states cannot be restored, and 3 points if dynamic filtering is not available. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the custom charts visualization system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code supports a variety of chart types (at minimum: line, bar, pie, scatter, table, heatmap) with appropriate configuration options for each type. Verify that chart customization includes axis labels, legends, tooltips, color schemes, and interactive features (zoom, drill-down, etc.). Deduct 5 points if responsive design for different screen sizes is missing, and 3 points if accessibility features are not considered. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the configuration preview/live update mechanism implemented?
checklist.description: Verify whether the code provides real-time preview functionality as users configure their reports and charts. Check if configuration changes immediately reflect in the visualization without requiring page reloads. The implementation should include data caching mechanisms and optimized rendering to prevent performance issues. Give 10 points for seamless live updates with minimal latency, 5 points if updates require manual refresh, and 0 if preview functionality is missing.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid configurations, data loading failures, empty datasets, network interruptions, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-suggested visualizations based on data patterns 2. Natural language query to generate reports 3. Collaborative editing with change history). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar configuration options (e.g., multiple ways to set the same property) 2. Function modules unrelated to reporting (e.g., unnecessary social features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations in the configuration interface). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating configuration logic/visualization rendering/data handling layers), component reusability, and state management approaches. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no clear separation between presentation and business logic. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
